translated: The yoga of inconceivable wisdom, which is non-conceptual and non-dual, is the beginningless, non-conceptual, trace-free dharmakƒÅya, the enumeration of emptiness, which is unchanging.üîΩBecause of that, the phenomena of sa·πÉsƒÅra, such as desire and so on, are imagined to exist due to the power of thought.

original: 'dir snying por gong du 'pho ba de yang yid kyis bsgoms pa tsam gyis na /
analyzed: 'dir snying por gong du 'pho ba de yang yid kyis bsgoms pa tsam gyis na /
translated: Here, that transference to the essence is also merely cultivated by the mind.

original: des na sngon 'gro ba zhes pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i sgom pa rnams yid las byung ngo //
analyzed: des na sngon 'gro ba zhes pa ni sngon du gsungs pa'i sgom pa rnams yid las byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, preceded refers to the meditations mentioned before, which arise from the mind.

original: chos zhes pa ni yid las 'byung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: chos zhes pa ni yid las 'byung ba med pa'o //
translated: The dharma does not arise from the mind.

original: de yang yid kyis dag ces pa ni bsgom pa bzang pos dag pa'o //
analyzed: de yang yid kyis dag ces pa ni bsgom pa bzang pos dag pa'o //
translated: Moreover, purified by the mind means purified by excellent meditation.

original: yid las byung zhes pa ni chos thams cad yid las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yid las byung zhes pa ni chos thams cad yid las 'byung ba'o //
translated: The arisen from the mind means all phenomena arise from the mind.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi rgyal po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yid kyis spros shing gsal bas na yid kyi rgyal po'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi rgyal po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yid kyis spros shing gsal bas na yid kyi rgyal po'o //
translated: Therefore, the king of the mind and so forth - since it is expanded and clarified by the mind, it is the king of the mind.

original: bka' drin gyis zhes pa ni yid kyis nus pa gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bka' drin gyis zhes pa ni yid kyis nus pa gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: By the kindness means the power of the mind is clarified.

original: ji ltar lus kyi bka' drin mi longs spyod rgyas pas lus rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar lus kyi bka' drin mi longs spyod rgyas pas lus rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the body is not enjoyed, the body expands by the expansion of enjoyment.

original: de bzhin du yid las khams gsum pa thams cad 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid las khams gsum pa thams cad 'byung ba'o //
translated: In the same way, all the three worlds arise from the mind.

original: des na chos dang chos can du brtags pa'i phyir ngag gi sgo nas brjod do //
analyzed: des na chos dang chos can du brtags pa'i phyir ngag gi sgo nas brjod do //
translated: Therefore, because of the imputation of the dharma and the dharmin, it is expressed verbally.

original: yang na byed ces pa ni khams gsum pa sprul pa'o //
analyzed: yang na byed ces pa ni khams gsum pa sprul pa'o //
translated: Or else, ‚Äúmaking‚Äù means the emanation of the three worlds.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: Thus, it is the world of the Buddha.

original: de bzhin du tha mal pa'i 'jig rten brjod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du tha mal pa'i 'jig rten brjod de /
translated: In the same way, the ordinary world is expressed.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni da ltar gyi sems can rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni da ltar gyi sems can rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po spro bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, etc. ‚Äî the present existence of sentient beings should be elaborated as cause and effect.

original: 'dir sngon nas thog ma med pa'i rgyud kyi phyir ma rig pa'i chos nyid kyi sems can rnams thams cad yid kyi rang bzhin no// des na sems can yid las byung //
analyzed: 'dir sngon nas thog ma med pa'i rgyud kyi phyir ma rig pa'i chos nyid kyi sems can rnams thams cad yid kyi rang bzhin no// des na sems can yid las byung //
translated: Here, because of the beginningless continuum from the past, all sentient beings, whose nature is ignorance, are of the nature of mind. Therefore, sentient beings arise from the mind.

original: zhes pa ni yid kyi rnam par rtog pa las gang byung ba'i ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yid kyi rnam par rtog pa las gang byung ba'i ma rig pa'o //
translated: Thus, ignorance arises from the conceptual mind.

original: de yang blo ldan zhes pa mkhas pas yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang blo ldan zhes pa mkhas pas yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: And that is to be completely abandoned by the wise.

original: de ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is that? It is said:
The first is theüîΩcause of the second.üîΩ

original: te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te ma rig pa yongs su spang bar 'od na de'i tshe bzlas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te ma rig pa yongs su spang bar 'od na de'i tshe bzlas zhes pa ni /
translated: etc. If one should completely abandon ignorance, then at that time one should recite.

original: sngon du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: sngon du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of the previously stated characteristics,

original: aa wa dh'u t'i'i nang du ye shes sems dpa'i snying ga'i ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i snying ga'i mchod rten lnga mtshon par bya ste ye shes kyi bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: aa wa dh'u t'i'i nang du ye shes sems dpa'i snying ga'i ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i snying ga'i mchod rten lnga mtshon par bya ste ye shes kyi bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: one should perform the gnosis recitation, which is the visualization of the five st≈´pas in the heart of the gnosis being in the middle of the avadh≈´ti.

original: rnal 'byor pa zhes pa ni sems tsam gyis so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa zhes pa ni sems tsam gyis so //
translated: The yogƒ´, with just the mind,

original: snying du zhes pa ni sems kyi snying po'o //
analyzed: snying du zhes pa ni sems kyi snying po'o //
translated: in the heart, the essence of the mind,

original: bsam pa zhes pa ni bsam du med pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: bsam pa zhes pa ni bsam du med pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: the inconceivable thing,

original: des na bsgom par bya'o //üîΩrags pa'i phung po la sogs pa dang skye mched rnams thig le bzhi'i nang du thim pa'o //
analyzed: des na bsgom par bya'o // rags pa'i phung po la sogs pa dang skye mched rnams thig le bzhi'i nang du thim pa'o //
translated: should meditate.üîΩThe coarse aggregates and so on and the sense bases dissolve into the four bindus.

original: der phung ngo phra mo thig le bzhi yang nam mkha'i nang du thim pa'o //
analyzed: der phung ngo phra mo thig le bzhi yang nam mkha'i nang du thim pa'o //
translated: There, the subtle four bindus dissolve into space.

original: de ltar phung po lnga phra mo la yang gzugs kyi phung po ni padma'i rtsa ba'i rnal ma lta bu'i rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar phung po lnga phra mo la yang gzugs kyi phung po ni padma'i rtsa ba'i rnal ma lta bu'i rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: Thus, in the five aggregates, the aggregate of form is the seventy-two thousand channels, which are like the root of a lotus.

original: de la aa wa dh'u t'i ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: de la aa wa dh'u t'i ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: In that, the avadh≈´tƒ´ is the aggregate of consciousness.

original: de'i nang gi ye shes sems dpa' ni tshor ba'i phung po'o /
analyzed: de'i nang gi ye shes sems dpa' ni tshor ba'i phung po'o /
translated: The gnosis being within that is the aggregate of feeling.

original: der ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: der ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: The samƒÅdhi being there is the aggregate of discrimination.

original: 'di nyid du gong du 'pho ba'i sgom pa de ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid du gong du 'pho ba'i sgom pa de ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: The meditation of upward transference in this very place is the aggregate of compositional factors.

original: de ltar brdas mchod rten lnga rags pa'i rnam pa nyid du dgongs so //
analyzed: de ltar brdas mchod rten lnga rags pa'i rnam pa nyid du dgongs so //
translated: Thus, the five symbolic st≈´pas are considered to be the aspect of the coarse.

original: de bzhin du rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Similarly, the cause, and so on, are as follows:

original: rgyu zhes pa ni der thim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu zhes pa ni der thim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause is the dissolution into that.

original: gyur zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gyur zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The transformation is form, and so on.

original: de'i sa bon zhes pa ni yid tsam pa khams lnga'i bdag nyid dam ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de'i sa bon zhes pa ni yid tsam pa khams lnga'i bdag nyid dam ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The seed of that is the mere mind, which is the nature of the five elements or the nature of the five gnoses.

original: des na yang de kho na'i gzugs min zhes pa ni /
analyzed: des na yang de kho na'i gzugs min zhes pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is not the form of reality itself.‚Äù

original: yi ge'i gzugs sam thig le'i gzugs ni don dam par mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yi ge'i gzugs sam thig le'i gzugs ni don dam par mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The form of syllables or the form of bindus does not arise in the ultimate.

original: 'on kyang de dag yid tsam brtag pa'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag yid tsam brtag pa'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: However, they are the nature of mere imagined form.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na gsungs pa /

original: rgyu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: 'bras bu zhes pa ni rang rig pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rim pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes pa ni rang rig pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rim pa mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEffect‚Äù is seeing the stage of perfect awakening through self-awareness.

original: de'i rgyu zhes pa ni phung po'i rang bzhin tsam mo //
analyzed: de'i rgyu zhes pa ni phung po'i rang bzhin tsam mo //
translated: ‚ÄúIts cause‚Äù is the mere nature of the aggregates.

original: des na sa bon zhes pa ni ma rig pa spangs pa'i sems can las rig pa bzang po 'byung la /
analyzed: des na sa bon zhes pa ni ma rig pa spangs pa'i sems can las rig pa bzang po 'byung la /
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúseed‚Äù is the arising of good awareness from the sentient being who has abandoned ignorance.

original: de las kyang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las kyang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: And from that, buddhas and bodhisattvas arise.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / de yang de kho na nyid mthong ba min //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de yang de kho na nyid mthong ba min //
translated: That is not seeing reality.

original: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams de kho na nyid kyi gzugs te re kho na nyid kyi gzugs te de nyid las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams de kho na nyid kyi gzugs te re kho na nyid kyi gzugs te de nyid las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the form of reality of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, because it arises from that alone.

original: de @243b yan lung las de rnams kyang mi rtag pa ste gang gi phyir sems can gyi ris dang / srog gi ris mi rtag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de @243b yan lung las de rnams kyang mi rtag pa ste gang gi phyir sems can gyi ris dang / srog gi ris mi rtag pa'i phyir te /
translated: In the scriptures, they are impermanent, because the realms of sentient beings and the realms of life are impermanent.

original: srog kyang 'khrul ba'i gzugs mi bden mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: srog kyang 'khrul ba'i gzugs mi bden mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Life is also a false form of delusion, having the character of unreality and impermanence.

original: des na de rnams kyis mthong ba min te mthong ba ni zad pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: des na de rnams kyis mthong ba min te mthong ba ni zad pa'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are not seen, because seeing is a thing that is exhausted. This is the conclusion.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa'i gzugs can no zhes pa ni 'gal te /
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad mi rtag pa'i gzugs can no zhes pa ni 'gal te /
translated: Here, the statement that all things, such as the buddhas, have impermanent form is contradictory.

original: 'dir theg pa gsum la sogs pa theg pa mchog gi chos thams cad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir theg pa gsum la sogs pa theg pa mchog gi chos thams cad du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: Here, the Blessed One has taught all the dharmas of the supreme vehicle, such as the three vehicles.

original: 'di ltar sa bon dang mtshan ma la sogs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i dngos po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskyed pa'i rim pas grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bon dang mtshan ma la sogs pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i dngos po de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bskyed pa'i rim pas grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: Thus, is not the entity of the aspects of form, etc. produced by the process of generation by the Tathagatas in the manner of a seed, a sign, etc.?

original: des na 'di ji ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pa 'ba' zhig gis byang chub bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: des na 'di ji ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pa 'ba' zhig gis byang chub bsgrub par bya /
translated: How then is enlightenment accomplished by the perfection stage alone?

original: gang yang sngags bzlas pas de yang 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldan pa'i yi ge gsum gyi brdas ston pa'i lung las gsung sna de ji ltar yid tsam gyis yid la yi ge lnga bzlas pa yin zhes 'ga' zhig dogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang yang sngags bzlas pas de yang 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldan pa'i yi ge gsum gyi brdas ston pa'i lung las gsung sna de ji ltar yid tsam gyis yid la yi ge lnga bzlas pa yin zhes 'ga' zhig dogs par 'gyur na /
translated: Also, with regard to the mantra recitation, since that is taught by the symbolic language of the three syllables, which are the entry and abiding, how is the recitation of the five syllables in the mind by the mind alone?

original: de la brjod pa 'dir de thams cad ni bden te /
analyzed: de la brjod pa 'dir de thams cad ni bden te /
translated: To that, we reply: here, all of that is true.

original: 'on kyang der bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' brjod ba /
analyzed: 'on kyang der bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' brjod ba /
translated: However, there the Bhagavat spoke

analyzed: de ltar bsdus pa yi ge ldan ni h'um zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, endowed with the syllable, it is h≈´·πÉ.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i nye ba'i longs spyod lnga yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'khor ba'i longs spyod kyi rgyur spyod pas skye ba len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i nye ba'i longs spyod lnga yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'khor ba'i longs spyod kyi rgyur spyod pas skye ba len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, the five objects, such as form, are enjoyed by the mental consciousness, which is the cause of the enjoyment of samsƒÅra, because it takes birth.

original: de'i phyir sngon gyi tshul la sogs pas yi ge gsum yid kyis bzlas pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon gyi tshul la sogs pas yi ge gsum yid kyis bzlas pa de la de skad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the mental recitation of the three syllables by the previous method and so on is called that.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyid ces pa ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyid ces pa ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The word just is for the purpose of exclusion.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzlas pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzlas pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The phrase permanent, etc. is a special reiteration.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: ye shes la ni rnam shes thim //
analyzed: ye shes la ni rnam shes thim //
translated: consciousness dissolves into intuition.

original: zhes bya ba ni yid kyi sgom pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ming can ye shes te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yid kyi sgom pas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ming can ye shes te /
translated: The word intuition is a synonym for the mental consciousness, because it is the mental contemplation.

original: de ltar de thim pa'i phyir mtshon pa'i mtshan nyid du byas pa'i 'bras bu mtshon pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar de thim pa'i phyir mtshon pa'i mtshan nyid du byas pa'i 'bras bu mtshon pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it dissolves into that, the result, which is characterized by the representation, becomes devoid of representation.

original: des na ye shes kyi dngos pa zhes pa ni 'jig rten pas rnam par shes pa mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: des na ye shes kyi dngos pa zhes pa ni 'jig rten pas rnam par shes pa mi mthong ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the word entity of intuition means that the world does not see consciousness.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang rnam par shes pa rtag pa'i @244b phyir sgyu ma lta bu'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rim pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa yang rnam par shes pa rtag pa'i @244b phyir sgyu ma lta bu'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rim pa mthong ba'o //
translated: The supramundane intuition is the seeing of the stages of perfect enlightenment, which are like illusions, because consciousness is permanent.

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i nang gi lta bas gong du 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sbyor ba goms pas de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi spyan la sogs pa brgyad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rnams bstan pa'i phyir de'i mtshan nyid bstan pa gsungs
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i nang gi lta bas gong du 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sbyor ba goms pas de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi spyan la sogs pa brgyad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rnams bstan pa'i phyir de'i mtshan nyid bstan pa gsungs
translated: The eight consciousnesses are the eight worldly ones. The supramundane ones are the eight inner views. The characteristics of the practice of the upward leap are cultivated. At that time, in order to demonstrate the eight eyes of the buddhas and so forth, the characteristics of the buddhas' wisdoms are taught.

original: te / mar me lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la thams cad ces pa ni dmyal ba'i nang du gnas pa'i dngos po thams cad de'i mig gi rnam par shes pas mar me'i rnam pa lta bur mthong ba'o //
analyzed: te / mar me lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la thams cad ces pa ni dmyal ba'i nang du gnas pa'i dngos po thams cad de'i mig gi rnam par shes pas mar me'i rnam pa lta bur mthong ba'o //
translated: It is said, Like a lamp, and so forth. All means all the things that exist in the hells. With that eye consciousness, they are seen like the aspect of a lamp.

original: de yang dmyal ba rnams thar pa'i rgyur snying rje gtsor mdzad do //
analyzed: de yang dmyal ba rnams thar pa'i rgyur snying rje gtsor mdzad do //
translated: Moreover, the buddhas, taking compassion as primary, liberate the hell beings.

original: de bzhin du nam mkha' snang ba zhes pa ni byol song gi 'gro ba la khyab pa'i rnam par shes pas rnam par bcom nas mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nam mkha' snang ba zhes pa ni byol song gi 'gro ba la khyab pa'i rnam par shes pas rnam par bcom nas mthong ba'o //
translated: Similarly, illuminating space means that by destroying the consciousness that pervades the animal realm, it is seen.

original: rdul zhes pa ni 'od zer rnams so //
analyzed: rdul zhes pa ni 'od zer rnams so //
translated: The particles are the light rays.

original: de bzhin du rdul dkar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul dkar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Likewise, ‚Äúwhite dust‚Äù and so forth.

original: tsa na ka'i ri lu lta bur 'od zer rnams sna'i rnam par shes pa las byung nas yi dags kyi 'gro ba rnams rnam par 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: tsa na ka'i ri lu lta bur 'od zer rnams sna'i rnam par shes pa las byung nas yi dags kyi 'gro ba rnams rnam par 'joms pa'o //
translated: Like a CƒÅ·πáakya pill, the light rays arise from the nose consciousness and destroy the hungry ghost realm.

original: de nyid nyon mongs 'joms zhes pa ni sngon gyi bag chags kyi ming rnams kyang rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi zhes pa mi'i lus las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid nyon mongs 'joms zhes pa ni sngon gyi bag chags kyi ming rnams kyang rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi zhes pa mi'i lus las byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself destroys the afflictions‚Äù means that even the names of past latent tendencies arise in the yogis‚Äô bodies.

original: de nas yang mi rnams kyi lus kyi gzugs sna tshogs pa bdag nyid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mthong bar 'gro ba de rnams bcom pas de thams cad stong ba'i skur mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de nas yang mi rnams kyi lus kyi gzugs sna tshogs pa bdag nyid kyi rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mthong bar 'gro ba de rnams bcom pas de thams cad stong ba'i skur mthong ba'o //
translated: Then, again, the various forms of the bodies of humans are seen by the characteristics of one‚Äôs consciousness. Since those migrating beings are destroyed, all of them are seen as empty bodies.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Likewise, ‚Äúdesire‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'dod pa na kun du spyod pa'i gnas bcu gcig po lus kyi rnam par shes pas mthong bas 'gro ba 'gog pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin gyi phyir longs spyod ces pa ni rang nyid sprul pa'i sku'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na kun du spyod pa'i gnas bcu gcig po lus kyi rnam par shes pas mthong bas 'gro ba 'gog pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin gyi phyir longs spyod ces pa ni rang nyid sprul pa'i sku'i phyir ro //
translated: In the desire realm, the eleven places of conduct are seen by the body consciousness, and because of the nature of that, they are enjoyed, since they are one‚Äôs own emanation body.

original: de bzhin du gzugs zhes pa ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bdag nyid kyi lha rnams ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs zhes pa ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bdag nyid kyi lha rnams ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Similarly, the form realm is the nature of the gods of the form realm.

original: de rnams kyang sgyu ma'i gzugs can mtho ris la longs spyod par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de rnams kyang sgyu ma'i gzugs can mtho ris la longs spyod par mthong ngo //
translated: They are also seen to enjoy the form of an emanation in the higher realms.

original: de ltar sems kyis mthong zhes pa'i tshul gyis gnas bcu drug gi lha rnams bzung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar sems kyis mthong zhes pa'i tshul gyis gnas bcu drug gi lha rnams bzung ngo //
translated: In that way, the gods of the sixteen places are apprehended in the manner of being seen by the mind.

original: de ltar ma gsungs kyang sngon du gsungs pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma gsungs kyang sngon du gsungs pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Even though that is not stated, the consciousnesses of the eyes and so on that were previously mentioned should be understood.

original: de ltar yang drug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha rnams bzhi @245a * //
analyzed: de ltar yang drug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha rnams bzhi @245a * //
translated: Thus, the four gods of the formless realm are also seen by the mind.

original: po nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dngos po mthong ngo //
analyzed: po nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dngos po mthong ngo //
translated: The entity of the afflicted mind consciousness is seen.

original: gang gi phyir tshor ba stong pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshor ba stong pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Because feeling is empty, it is said to be so.

original: de bzhin du bdun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Similarly, in the seventh, etc.,

original: chos kyi dbyings nyid ces pa ni kun gzhi rnams par shes pa'i rang bzhin dmigs pa med pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings te de las chos rnams thams cad 'byung ba de rnams 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nyid ces pa ni kun gzhi rnams par shes pa'i rang bzhin dmigs pa med pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings te de las chos rnams thams cad 'byung ba de rnams 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The dharmadhƒÅtu itself is the dharmadhƒÅtu because the nature of the all-base consciousness is non-apprehensible. Since all phenomena arise from that, they cease due to that.

original: brgyad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji skad du gsungs pa bzhin du 'gyur te gzhan du ma yin zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji skad du gsungs pa bzhin du 'gyur te gzhan du ma yin zhes pa ste nges pa'o //
translated: In the eighth, etc., it is as stated, not otherwise - this is the determination.

original: de bzhin du gong du 'bo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gong du 'bo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi sangs rgyas nyid kyi 'bras bur 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, for the yogins who are intent on the highest, there is the result of buddhahood.

original: rang gi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their own nature is fully known.

original: de ltar rnam pa dang bcas pa'i bsgoms pa las shin tu zab pa'i mthar snang ba med pa'i ye shes chos kyi dbyings su brjod pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa dang bcas pa'i bsgoms pa las shin tu zab pa'i mthar snang ba med pa'i ye shes chos kyi dbyings su brjod pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the wisdom devoid of appearances, which is more profound than the meditation with aspects, is taught to be the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdor bstan pa'i phyir sngon du zhus pa gsal ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mdor bstan pa'i phyir sngon du zhus pa gsal ba'i don to //
translated: Here, the Blessed One teaches in brief, clarifying the meaning of what was previously asked.

original: da ni sngon du gsungs pa'i ston pa nyid rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba'i dngos brgyal tsam gyis sems dri ma med pa'i phyir phung po dang mkhas dang skye mched la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa brjod de /
analyzed: da ni sngon du gsungs pa'i ston pa nyid rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba'i dngos brgyal tsam gyis sems dri ma med pa'i phyir phung po dang mkhas dang skye mched la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa brjod de /
translated: Now, the teacher himself, having experienced the previously stated reality through his own direct perception, declares the purity of the aggregates, sense bases, and so forth due to the stainlessness of the mind.

original: rdo rje snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje snying po zhes bya ba ni rdo rje snying po la bod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rdo rje snying po zhes bya ba ni rdo rje snying po la bod pa'o //
translated: The phrase the essence of the vajra and so forth refers to the essence of the vajra.

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid rdo rje snying po ste de nyid kyis na brtses pa chen po zhes pa ni snying rje'i sgo nas bod pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid rdo rje snying po ste de nyid kyis na brtses pa chen po zhes pa ni snying rje'i sgo nas bod pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One himself is the essence of the vajra, and therefore he is called the Great Compassionate One, referring to compassion.

original: de yang snying rje ni thos pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de yang snying rje ni thos pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Moreover, compassion is the application to listening.

original: de ci zhe na dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i nang du gnas pa chos kyi dbyings kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las dngos po thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa sngon du mtshan
analyzed: de ci zhe na dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i nang du gnas pa chos kyi dbyings kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las dngos po thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa sngon du mtshan
translated: What is that?

original: ma'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshon par chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: ma'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshon par chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: The dharmadhƒÅtu is indicated by the characteristics of the signs that precede the purification of those, because all things arise from the dharmadhƒÅtu ƒÅlaya consciousness that abides within the ƒÅlaya consciousness.

original: de yang de bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Moreover, that is suchness and the perfect limit.

original: phyi nas re re'i zhes pa ni lus kyi dngos po'i phyir khams bzhi la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir so sor yongs su brtag par rab tu brjod pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nas re re'i zhes pa ni lus kyi dngos po'i phyir khams bzhi la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir so sor yongs su brtag par rab tu brjod pa'o //
translated: After that, each is said to be thoroughly investigated, because the nature of the four elements and so on is the cause of the body.

original: ni ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: ni ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is a restriction.

original: lha rnams kyi zhes pa ni rags pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad dang sngon du gsungs pa'i phra mo 'dir rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis lha rnams te de rnams las byung ba sgyu ma'i @245b rnam pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi zhes pa ni rags pa'i rnam par shes pa brgyad dang sngon du gsungs pa'i phra mo 'dir rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis lha rnams te de rnams las byung ba sgyu ma'i @245b rnam pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The ‚Äúgods‚Äù are the seventy-two thousand subtle channels mentioned above, and the ‚Äúnature of the forms of illusion‚Äù that arises from them is mere appearance.

original: de yang snang ba tsam de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang snang ba tsam de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: And that is the nature of reality.

original: de'i phyir rtsa rnams kyi phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtsa rnams kyi phung po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the ‚Äúaggregates of channels‚Äù and so forth are the aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, and so forth of the yogis and yoginis.

original: sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin zhes pa brtags na stong ba ste gong du rdul phra rab bzhin du blta ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rang bzhin zhes pa brtags na stong ba ste gong du rdul phra rab bzhin du blta ba'o //
translated: Or, the ‚Äúnature of sentient beings‚Äù is empty when examined, as was the case with the atoms above.

original: rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ba'i 'jig rten ni chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni rnal 'byor ba'i 'jig rten ni chos kyi dbyings kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúPure‚Äù means that the world of the yogis and yoginis is the nature of the ultimate expanse.

original: de bzhin du byis pa rnams kyis mi shes pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa mi shes pa shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byis pa rnams kyis mi shes pa zhes pa la sogs pa ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa mi shes pa shes bya'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: Likewise, ‚Äúignorance of what is not known by the childish‚Äù and so on is the obscuration of the knowable, which is non-afflicted ignorance.

original: nyon mongs pa zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAfflictions‚Äù are the obscurations of the afflictions, such as attachment.

original: de dag gis bsgribs shing dri ma can du byas pa rnams par sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis bsgribs shing dri ma can du byas pa rnams par sbyangs pa'o //
translated: They are purified of those, which have been made defiled.

original: de rnams kyi glo bur ba'i dri ma bsal ba'i don du skye ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi glo bur ba'i dri ma bsal ba'i don du skye ste /
translated: They are born for the purpose of removing the adventitious defilements of those.

original: mi shes pa de rnams kyi dri ma bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi shes pa de rnams kyi dri ma bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove the defilements of those ignorances,

original: thabs gang gis sbyangs pa 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: thabs gang gis sbyangs pa 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: the means by which they are purified is stated here:

original: rang rig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir sngon du bshad pa'i rang rig pa de'i rang bzhin des rnam par dag ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang rig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir sngon du bshad pa'i rang rig pa de'i rang bzhin des rnam par dag ces pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúBy self-awareness‚Äù and so on. Here, by that nature of self-awareness explained before, it is purified. This is the meaning.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gsungs pa / gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir rang rig pa las gzhan pa'i rnam par dag pa'i khyad par du dag par mi brjod de /
analyzed: gsungs pa / gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi phyir rang rig pa las gzhan pa'i rnam par dag pa'i khyad par du dag par mi brjod de /
translated: The statement ‚Äúother than that‚Äù and so on is because other than reflexive awareness, a special purity is not described as pure.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pas na /
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pas na /
translated: Since all obscurations together with their traces are pure,

original: rnam par dag pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the meaning of ‚Äúpure‚Äù is stated.

original: 'o na de rnam par dag pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa de ni yun ring po'i dus su bsgoms shing lam 'di la dmigs pa yin na sngon du ji ltar rang bzhin gyis thams cad dag par 'gyur des na gsungs pa ;
analyzed: 'o na de rnam par dag pa'i 'bras bur gyur pa de ni yun ring po'i dus su bsgoms shing lam 'di la dmigs pa yin na sngon du ji ltar rang bzhin gyis thams cad dag par 'gyur des na gsungs pa ;
translated: Well then, if that is the result of purity, it is cultivated for a long time, and if this path is observed, how is it that everything is pure by nature beforehand?üîΩThus it is said:

original: yul rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: yul rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe objects‚Äù and so on.

original: yul dang dbang po la sogs pa rang rig gi shes pa dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po la sogs pa rang rig gi shes pa dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the objects, the sense organs, and so on are observed by reflexive awareness,

original: de rnams kyi rang rig pa'i bde ba'i mchog don dam pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang rig pa'i bde ba'i mchog don dam pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the meaning of ‚Äúthe supreme bliss of reflexive awareness of those‚Äù is the ultimate.

original: de ci zhe na gsungs pa dngos po dag phyir zhes pa ni dag pa de rnams kyang gnyis med pa stong pa'i rang gi ngo bo reg pa byed pa nyid kyis na stong ba nyid nyams su myong pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ci zhe na gsungs pa dngos po dag phyir zhes pa ni dag pa de rnams kyang gnyis med pa stong pa'i rang gi ngo bo reg pa byed pa nyid kyis na stong ba nyid nyams su myong pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: What is that? It is said, ‚Äúbecause of the purity of things.‚Äù That purity is the experience of emptiness, because of the nature of experiencing emptiness.

original: dngos po yang sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo'i phyir dngos po dag pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po yang sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo'i phyir dngos po dag pa ste /
translated: And things are pure, because of the nature of generating the mind.

original: de med pa ni de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de med pa ni de kho na nyid do //
translated: That non-existence is reality.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid nyams su myong ba thun mong gi 'bras bu gyur pa rang rig pa'i bde ba ni shes bya @246a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid nyams su myong ba thun mong gi 'bras bu gyur pa rang rig pa'i bde ba ni shes bya @246a * //
translated: Therefore, the common result of the experience of emptiness is the bliss of self-awareness, which is the nature of all objects of knowledge.

original: thams cad dang dbyer med pa'i phyir zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: thams cad dang dbyer med pa'i phyir zhes dgongs so //
translated: It is intended that it is indivisible from all objects of knowledge.

original: de nyid kyis ni stong pa nyid kyi cha de bzhin nyid kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni stong pa nyid kyi cha de bzhin nyid kho na nyid do //
translated: By that very thing, the aspect of emptiness is reality just as it is.

original: dngos po rnams kyi stong pa dngos po'i cha rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo la dmigs pa'i dbye bas nyams su myong ba'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi stong pa dngos po'i cha rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor lo la dmigs pa'i dbye bas nyams su myong ba'i dbye ba'o //

analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i dbye bas so sor dmigs pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid do //

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dmigs pa'i dbye bas nyams su myong ba'i dbye bas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbye ba ste so sor dmigs pa zhes pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dmigs pa'i dbye bas nyams su myong ba'i dbye bas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbye ba ste so sor dmigs pa zhes pa de la de skad ces bya'o //

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba'i rim pa bzhin du gzugs thams cad dang sgra thams cad dang sems kyi g-yo ba thams cad chos kyi dbyings su song bas na sems can gyi khams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'o
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba'i rim pa bzhin du gzugs thams cad dang sgra thams cad dang sems kyi g-yo ba thams cad chos kyi dbyings su song bas na sems can gyi khams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'o
translated: Thus, just like the stages of the secret of the body, speech, and mind of all the TathƒÅgatas, all forms, all sounds, and all movements of mind are included in the dharmadhƒÅtu. Therefore, the realm of sentient beings is the TathƒÅgata.üîΩHere, if that assembly of sentient beings is the TathƒÅgata, then, since they are purified by the reality that is the secret of the TathƒÅgata, there is not the slightest impurity.

original: // 'dir gal te sems can gyi tshogs de rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i rjes su song ba de kho na nyid kyis rnam par sbyangs pas ma dag pa cung zad med ces pas bgros nas zhus pa /

original: ste gnyis pa'o /
